name: HubSpot

name: Intercom

name: Box

name: Cloudinary
description: Cloudinary MCP server enables AI-driven media workflows including image/video upload, transformation, optimization, tagging, search, and CDN asset management.

name: PayPal
description: Remote MCP server that lets MCP-compatible AI clients securely interact with PayPal commerce workflows. Typical use cases include creating and capturing orders, issuing refunds, and handling dispute workflows—so agents can automate common payment operations without leaving the chat/dev environment.

name: Plaid
description: Dashboard-focused remote MCP server for Plaid that enables AI tools and agents to access Plaid dashboard diagnostics and analytics, helping teams debug integrations faster, surface health and usage insights, and reduce time spent navigating dashboard pages manually.

name: Square
description: Remote MCP server that exposes a small, layered set of tools to explore Square API capabilities, inspect request/response schemas, and execute operations (payments, catalog, orders, customers, etc.). Designed to keep the MCP surface minimal while still enabling access to many Square endpoints through discovery + typed execution.

name: Dodo Payments
description: API-key authenticated MCP endpoint for integrating Dodo Payments into agent workflows. Intended for programmatic payment operations (creating payment intents/charges, managing customers, refunds, and basic reporting) from within MCP-compatible clients.

name: Mercado Pago
description: API-key based MCP server for Mercado Pago that enables agents to work with LATAM payment flows (checkout/payment creation, status lookups, refunds/chargebacks where supported) from MCP-enabled environments. Useful for automating payment ops and building support/debug workflows around transactions.

name: Close CRM
description: Official Close remote MCP server that lets AI clients securely query and operate on Close CRM data. Supports read-only and write scopes (including safe writes and destructive writes) so agents can search leads/contacts/activities, fetch pipelines and templates, and (with permission) create or update CRM objects.

name: Close (API Key)
description: Close MCP server access using an API key instead of OAuth, intended for custom MCP client setups or server-to-server usage. Scope is typically controlled via headers (read/write safe/write destructive) to restrict what tools and actions an agent can perform.

name: HubSpot
description: HubSpot MCP offering that connects MCP-compatible agents to HubSpot CRM context. The remote server is designed for controlled, secure access to CRM objects (e.g., contacts, companies, deals, tickets, and related standard records) to generate insights, summaries, and reporting from HubSpot data inside AI tools.

name: Intercom
description: Intercom MCP server that allows AI agents to securely retrieve and act on Intercom workspace context—such as conversations, contacts, tickets, and help center/internal articles—enabling faster support workflows, summarization, routing, and operational reporting inside MCP-enabled tools.

name: Box
description: Box MCP server that enables AI agents to securely access and operate on Box content (files, folders, search, metadata). Supports both a Box-hosted remote MCP server (enabled in the Admin Console) and community/self-hosted options, extending agents with content retrieval, searching, and structured extraction workflows.

name: Egnyte
description: Fully-managed Egnyte Remote MCP Server that connects AI tools to Egnyte content securely via OAuth. Designed for governed enterprise content use cases: searching files, summarizing documents, extracting insights, and respecting existing permissions and sharing controls.

name: Cloudinary
description: Cloudinary MCP servers (beta) that let AI agents upload, manage, transform, analyze, and organize images/videos directly from MCP-compatible clients. Useful for media pipelines: generating optimized assets, applying transformations, searching assets, and automating metadata/tagging workflows.

name: Audioscrape
description: Audioscrape MCP server for discovering, searching, and extracting information from large-scale spoken-audio sources (e.g., podcasts, interviews, talks). Enables agents to run audio search and retrieval workflows and then use results as context for summaries, citations, and RAG pipelines.

name: Carbon Voice
description: Carbon Voice MCP that connects your AI assistant to asynchronous voice conversations. Helps agents retrieve and summarize voice threads, turn voice updates into structured notes/action items, and manage workspace conversations without copy-pasting audio context.
